text.p: Shares of Malayan Banking Bhd (Maybank) and stockbroker Rashid Hussain Bhd requoted higher on Monday, at 27.00 ringgit and 19.00 ringgit, respectively.

Last week, Rashid Hussain and Maybank, Malaysia's largest commercial bank, signed a deal in which Rashid would acquire 75 percent of the equity in Maybank's Kwong Yik Bank Bhd for 8.80 ringgit a share or a total of 2.16 billion ringgit.
Under the deal, Kwong Yik will be merged with Rahid's 20- percent owned DCB Holdings Bhd banking unit, DCB Bank Bhd.
All four company stocks have been suspended since late October for the news announcement.
Kwong Yik stock requoted at 9.00 ringgit, up 2.05 ringgit, while DCB Holdings opened at 9.50 ringgit versus a previous closing price of 8.65 ringgit.

Dealers had said the gray, or off-market, price being quoted for Rashid's stock was between 18.00 ringgit and 21.00 ringgit a share. Rashid, which runs Malaysia's largest institutional stockbroker, closed at 15.80 ringgit on October 18.
Maybank's stock closed at 25 ringgit on October 18.
